Professor's Note: I get a lot of questions about when to use o and o/ Vn. Just
remember that the standard deviation of the mean of many observations is less
than the standard deviation of a single observation. If the standard deviation
of monthly stock returns is 2%, the standard error (deviation) of the average
monthly return over the next six months is 2% I16 = 0.82%. The average
of several observations of a random variable will be less widely dispersed
(have lower standard deviation) around the expected value than will a single
observation of the random variable.
